1568893908_1KkYDy7vnYwccFCDugksbCb4izK5H.body:
> [filips](#comment_209_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): What are you talking about? Again nonsense statements without any proofs. [...]

There is no perfectly safe browser. If there was one, the us government would shut it down and make it disappear or force the company to distribute it with some 'bug' that can be exploited. I'm using one that in my opinion is better and more safe than mozilla firefox.  One point of my safety is by not revealing which one it is.
As some know, the only way of being truly anonymous is by hiding ip addres. The only way of hiding ip address is by NOT having one. The only way of not having one is by a public free wifi hotspot (or stolen credential for a private wifi). also a computer you buy with cash, without any hdd or ssd, and run by a live os, and some more shrewdness. We can hide from our isp and from our local police and local government, which is something, but we will never hide from the big corporation espionage and big government intelligence. I'm using a windows 10 OS, so i'm basically screwed. But i don't mind. I'm pefectly aware that i'm not completely anonymous. I'm doing nothing worth the attention of the cia/fbi, mi6 or the mossad. They surely have the means to find me. But since i'm not a threat to anybody...

> [funman](#comment_8_12nYWrJ4WfemBx1sC1w3wTUJsX7iSkTv4c): I'd much rather use firefox than edge or chrome or ie or safari - sure firefox may have some bugs, but less bugs than any other proprietory browser.  Id have to see some proof of that - bring up the code for the backdoor, explain how you know it's a backdoor, show us you even know anything about what you are talking about.

forensics KNOW exactly which browser you are using with Tor because Tor RECOMMENDS Mozilla Firefox. If you switch browser you gain an advantage. I guess better stay away from Chrome or Opera. There are others valid open source web browsers.

1570044887_1KkYDy7vnYwccFCDugksbCb4izK5H.body:
FBI is an American crime drama television series created by Dick Wolf and Craig Turk that airs on CBS, where it premiered on September 25, 2018.[2] The series is produced by CBS Television Studios and Universal Television, with Wolf, Arthur W. Forney, Peter Jankowski, and Turk serving as executive producers. The series features an ensemble cast including Missy Peregrym, ZEEKO ZAKI, Jeremy Sisto, Ebonée Noel, Sela Ward and Alana de la Garza.
Born into a multi-generational law enforcement family, Special Agent Maggie Bell commits deeply to the people she works with as well as those she protects. Her partner is Special Agent Omar Adom "O. A." Zidan, a West Point graduate from Bushwick who spent two years undercover for the DEA before being cherry-picked by the FBI.

Zeeko Zaki (born January 18, 1990)[1][2] is an American actor best known for his role portraying Omar Adom "O. A." Zidan on Dick Wolf's FBI.[3]

Zaki was born in Alexandria, Egypt, and emigrated to the United States at one month of age.[1][4] Zaki's maternal grandparents immigrated before him and his parents.[2] His extended family remained in Egypt, and Zaki visited his hometown during the summers of his childhood.[5]
Zeeko Zaki is a practicing MUSLIM.[2][4][5] Zaki speaks both English and ARABICfluently.[4]
